sen.j: 源氏将軍（げんじしょうぐん）とは、征夷大将軍に任ぜられた源氏。
sen.e: Genji Shoguns (Warrior Generals) were the Genji clan members given the responsibility of unifying commander-in-chief.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Genji Shoguns (Warrior Generals) were the Genji clan members given the responsibility of unifying commander-in-chief.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Genji Shoguns (Warrior Generals) were the Minamoto clan members given the responsibility of seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians").
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 特に清和源氏出身の将軍をいう。
sen.e: In particular, it is said he was a Shogun (general) who hailed from the Seiwa Minamoto clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In particular, it is said he was a Shogun (general) who hailed from the Seiwa Minamoto clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In particular, it is said he was a Shogun (general) who hailed from the Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan).
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 源氏将軍とは、狭義には鎌倉幕府を開いた源頼朝、源頼家、源実朝の三代の将軍を指す。
sen.e: In a narrow sense, the Genji Shoguns are identified as 3 generations of Shoguns that commenced with MINAMOTO no Yoritomo (who set up the Kamakura Bakufu (Shogunate)), MINAMOTO no Yoriie and MINAMOTO no Sanetomo.

In a narrow sense, the Genji Shoguns are identified as 3 generations of Shoguns that commenced with MINAMOTO no Yoritomo (who set up the Kamakura Bakufu (Shogunate)), MINAMOTO no Yoriie and MINAMOTO no Sanetomo.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In a narrow sense, the Genji Shoguns are identified as three generations of Shoguns that commenced with MINAMOTO no Yoritomo (who set up the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun)), MINAMOTO no Yoriie and MINAMOTO no Sanetomo.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 広義には頼朝より先に征夷大将軍となった源義仲や室町幕府を開いた河内源氏の同族。
sen.e: In a broader sense, unifying commander-in-chief Shoguns who preceded Yoritomo can be included: MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka and the founder of the Muromachi Bakufu (Shogunate) of the same Kawachi Genji clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In a broader sense, unifying commander-in-chief Shoguns who preceded Yoritomo can be included: MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka and the founder of the Muromachi Bakufu (Shogunate) of the same Kawachi Genji clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In a broader sense, seii taishogun who preceded Yoritomo can be included: MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka and the founder of the Muromachi bakufu of the same Kawachi-Genji (Minamoto clan).
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 足利尊氏を初代とする足利将軍家。
sen.e: Also included is Takauji ASHIKAGA, the patriarch of the Ashikaga Shogun family line.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Also included is Takauji ASHIKAGA, the patriarch of the Ashikaga Shogun family line.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Also included is Takauji ASHIKAGA, the patriarch of the Ashikaga Shogun family line.
sen.cmt: スペース削除しました。

sen.j: 源氏を称して江戸幕府を開いた徳川将軍家も含まれる。
sen.e: Also supposedly laying claim to the Genji clan line is the family of Tokugawa Shoguns who established the Edo Shogunate.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Also supposedly laying claim to the Genji clan line is the family of Tokugawa Shoguns who established the Edo Shogunate.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Also supposedly laying claim to the Minamoto clan line is the family of Tokugawa Shoguns who established the Edo bakufu.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 俗に、源氏であることが征夷大将軍に任ぜられる条件であるという源氏将軍神話が誕生する。
sen.e: At the layman's level, a myth emerged that being a Genji shogun evidently presupposed taking the responsibility as a unifying commander-in-chief Shogun.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: At the layman's level, a myth emerged that being a Genji shogun evidently presupposed taking the responsibility as a unifying commander-in-chief Shogun.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: At the layman's level, a myth about Genji Shogun that being Minamoto clan was required to assume the position of seii taishogun.
sen.cmt: 表現を変えました。

sen.j: しかし、もとよりそうした条件は存在しない。
sen.e: However, initially no such requirement existed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, initially no such requirement existed.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: However, initially no such requirement existed.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: もちろん、足利将軍家や徳川将軍家など源姓を称する一族に世襲の官職として独占されていた側面はある。
sen.e: Of course, there are those amongst the Ashikaga and Tokugawa shogun clans etc that took to using the title as part of their name and, their relatives' monopolized aspects of government service on a hereditary basis.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Of course, there are those amongst the Ashikaga and Tokugawa shogun clans etc that took to using the title as part of their name and, their relatives' monopolized aspects of government service on a hereditary basis.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Of course, there are those amongst the Ashikaga and Tokugawa shogun families and so on that took to using the Minamoto clan as part of their name and, their relatives' monopolized aspects of government service on a hereditary basis.
sen.cmt: 表現を変えました。

sen.j: 古く遡れば平安時代、征夷大将軍に任ぜられた大伴弟麻呂や坂上田村麻呂以来、征夷大将軍の任免は源氏に限らず。
sen.e: Looking back further still to the Heian period, in the timeframe following Otomo no Otomaro and Sakanoue no Tamuramaro`s duties as unifying commander-in-chief Shoguns, taking on the role of unifying commander-in-chief Shogun was not limited to the Genji clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Looking back further still to the Heian period, in the timeframe following Otomo no Otomaro and Sakanoue no Tamuramaro`s duties as unifying commander-in-chief Shoguns, taking on the role of unifying commander-in-chief Shogun was not limited to the Genji clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Looking back further still to the Heian period, in the timeframe following OTOMO no Otomaro and SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro's duties as seii taishogun, taking on the role of seii taishogun was not limited to the Minamoto clan.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: むしろ頼朝の従弟である源義仲が征夷大将軍に任じられるまで、源氏は征夷大将軍になる資格すらなかった。
sen.e: By contrast, until Yoritomo cousin MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka assumed the mantle of unifying commander-in-chief, the Genji had no claim at all to the title of unifying commander-in-chief Shogun.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: By contrast, until Yoritomo cousin MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka assumed the mantle of unifying commander-in-chief, the Genji had no claim at all to the title of unifying commander-in-chief Shogun.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: By contrast, until Yoritomo cousin MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka assumed the mantle of seii taishogun, the Minamoto clan had no claim at all to the title of seii taishogun.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: それは、そもそも、鎮守府及びその長官である鎮守府将軍の職が陸奥に置かれた。
sen.e: This was because in the first instance, the role was assumed by the army base shogun (who was commander of the base) which was located in Mutsu Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: This was because in the first instance, the role was assumed by the army base shogun (who was commander of the base) which was located in Mutsu Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: This was because in the first instance, the role was assumed by Chinju-fu (Pacification and Defense Headquarters) and Chinju-fu shogun (Commander-in-Chief of the Defense of the North) both located in Mutsu Province.
sen.cmt: 表現を変えました。

sen.j: 平安時代も中期以降は征夷大将軍の任命すら行われなかった。
sen.e: From around the middle of the Heian period， role of unifying commander-in-chief Shogun was held as a matter of course by this individual.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: From around the middle of the Heian period， role of unifying commander-in-chief Shogun was held as a matter of course by this individual.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: From around the middle of the Heian period, role of seii taishogun was held as a matter of course by this individual.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 源氏初の征夷大将軍 義仲もはじめは清和源氏を征夷大将軍にした前例がないとして一度は退けた程である。
sen.e: Furthermore, the appointment of Yoshinaka as the initial Seiwa Minamoto clan unifying commander-in-chief Shogun was unprecedented as Yoshinaka was initially overlooked for the role.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, the appointment of Yoshinaka as the initial Seiwa Minamoto clan unifying commander-in-chief Shogun was unprecedented as Yoshinaka was initially overlooked for the role.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Furthermore, the appointment of Yoshinaka as the initial Seiwa-Genji's seii taishogun was unprecedented as Yoshinaka was initially overlooked for the role.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: まして、武家の棟梁といわれる系譜は源氏に限らない。
sen.e: It goes without saying therefore, key samurai families with pedigree are not limited to the Genji clan.
It goes without saying therefore, key samurai families with pedigree are not limited to the Genji clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: It goes without saying therefore, key samurai families with pedigree are not limited to the Minamoto clan.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: いずれの時代においても源氏でなければ将軍になれないという必然性は存在しない。
sen.e: Whichever historical period is reviewed, it is not inevitable that to be shogun one had to be a Genji.
Whichever historical period is reviewed, it is not inevitable that to be shogun one had to be a Genji.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Whichever historical period is reviewed, it is not inevitable that to be shogun one had to be a Minamoto clan.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 確かに清和源氏は武家源氏の代表格である。
sen.e: What is certain is, the Seiwa Minamoto clan was representative of the Genji samurai family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: What is certain is, the Seiwa Minamoto clan was representative of the Genji samurai family.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: What is certain is, the Seiwa-Genji was representative of the Minamoto samurai family.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 東国武士をまとめあげたという点で他の武門を圧倒する家格と勢力を誇った。
sen.e: From a standpoint of amalgamating the samurai forces in the Eastern provinces, they were proud of their efforts and having been the family to overwhelm other samurai families.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: From a standpoint of amalgamating the samurai forces in the Eastern provinces, they were proud of their efforts and having been the family to overwhelm other samurai families.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: From a standpoint of amalgamating the samurai forces in the eastern provinces, they were proud of their efforts and having been the family to overwhelm other samurai families.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 清和源氏のうち特に頼朝の属した河内源氏は源義家のように武勇に名高い。
sen.e: Members of the Seiwa Minamoto clan and in particular Yoritomo`s Kawachi Genji clan were held in high regard for their bravery (along with Minamoto vo Yoshiie).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Members of the Seiwa Minamoto clan and in particular Yoritomo`s Kawachi Genji clan were held in high regard for their bravery (along with Minamoto vo Yoshiie).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Members of the Seiwa-Genji and in particular Yoritomo's Kawachi-Genji clan were held in high regard for their bravery (along with Minamoto no Yoshiie).
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 武家の棟梁、源氏の大将、源氏嫡流と称され東国武士の求心力たり得る家系であった。
sen.e: As a leading samurai military family, the leaders of the Genji clan and its line of eldest sons was the family lineage that managed to unify and amalgamate the forces of the samurai of the Eastern provinces.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: As a leading samurai military family, the leaders of the Genji clan and its line of eldest sons was the family lineage that managed to unify and amalgamate the forces of the samurai of the Eastern provinces.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: As a leading samurai military family, the leaders of the Minamoto clan and its line of eldest sons was the family lineage that managed to unify and amalgamate the forces of the samurai of the eastern provinces.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 一時は源氏を朝敵に追いやり朝廷の実権を掌握した平家に対して、後に追討の宣旨が発せられた。
sen.e: For a brief period of time, the Genji were commanded by imperial order to pursue the enemy Heike (who had seized real power from the imperial court) and subsequently ordered to hunt down and kill the Heike clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: For a brief period of time, the Genji were commanded by imperial order to pursue the enemy Heike (who had seized real power from the imperial court) and subsequently ordered to hunt down and kill the Heike clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: For a brief period of time, the Minamoto clan were commanded by imperial order to pursue the enemy Taira family (who had seized real power from the imperial court) and subsequently ordered to hunt down and kill the Taira family.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: これを受けて再び挙兵した源氏によって滅ぼされると東国に朝廷の支配を受けない武家政権が樹立された。
sen.e: Receiving these commands, the Genji mobilized its army again but, samurai military government powers were established when the Genji would not take orders from the imperial court ensconced in the Eastern provinces.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Receiving these commands, the Genji mobilized its army again but, samurai military government powers were established when the Genji would not take orders from the imperial court ensconced in the Eastern provinces.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Receiving these commands, the Minamoto clan mobilized its army again but, samurai military government powers were established when the Minamoto clan would not take orders from the imperial court ensconced in the eastern provinces.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 結果的に源氏が唯一にして最大の武門の棟梁たる氏族としての地位を形成していったことは確かだろう。
sen.e: It is thought this outcome is proof positive that the social standing of the Genji as the supreme military family presence was forged.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is thought this outcome is proof positive that the social standing of the Genji as the supreme military family presence was forged.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: It is thought this outcome is proof positive that the social standing of the Minamoto clan as the supreme military family presence was forged.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: とはいいながら、実際には頼朝により初の全国的な武家政権として発足した鎌倉幕府において実朝が暗殺されて以降、頼朝の遠縁（妹の曾孫）とはいえ藤原氏の嫡流である摂家より4代将軍として藤原頼経が招かれ摂家将軍が成立した。
sen.e: That said, the first Japan-wide military rule by a military family was actually set up by Yoritomo with the Kamakura Bakufu (Shogunate) following the assassination of Sanetomo. Even though it could be said that Yoritomo was a distant relative (great grandchild), he was invited to establish a system of shogun regents by FUJIWARA no Yoritsune; a 4th generation eldest son lineage from the Fujiwara family line of regents.

That said, the first Japan-wide military rule by a military family was actually set up by Yoritomo with the Kamakura Bakufu (Shogunate) following the assassination of Sanetomo. Even though it could be said that Yoritomo was a distant relative (great grandchild), he was invited to establish a system of shogun regents by FUJIWARA no Yoritsune; a 4th generation eldest son lineage from the Fujiwara family line of regents.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: That said, the first Japan-wide military rule by a military family was in fact set up by Yoritomo with the Kamakura bakufu following the assassination of Sanetomo and after that even though it could be said that Yoritomo was a distant relative (great grandchild), he was invited to establish a system of shogun regents by FUJIWARA no Yoritsune; a fourth generation oldest son lineage from the Fujiwara family line of regents.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。統一リストに合わせました。actually→in fact

sen.j: 後に皇族から宮将軍が招かれたように、源氏でなければ将軍になれないという慣例は鎌倉幕府自身によって否定されている。
sen.e: Subsequently, it appears he was welcomed as a royal (imperial) shogun by the imperial family so, the precedent that one could not become a shogun unless of Genji stock was overturned at the behest of the Kamakura Bakufu (Shogunate) itself.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Subsequently, it appears he was welcomed as a royal (imperial) shogun by the imperial family so, the precedent that one could not become a shogun unless of Genji stock was overturned at the behest of the Kamakura Bakufu (Shogunate) itself.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Subsequently, it appears he was welcomed as a miyashogun (shogun from the Imperial Court) from the Imperial families, so the precedent that one could not become a shogun unless of the Minamoto clan stock was overturned at the behest of the Kamakura bakufu itself.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: むしろ、頼朝の同族である清和源氏は外様として処遇されたり、謀叛の疑いにより滅ぼされている。
sen.e: However, Yoritomo was treated as an outsider (even though he came from the same family in the Seiwa Minamoto clan) and, was ruined due to doubts about his allegiances.
However, Yoritomo was treated as an outsider (even though he came from the same family in the Seiwa Minamoto clan) and, was ruined due to doubts about his allegiances.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: However, Yoritomo was treated as an outsider (even though he came from the same family in the Seiwa-Genji) and, was ruined due to doubts about his allegiances.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: もちろん、全国の武士の求心力たり得た源氏が将軍であるべきという観念がまったくの幻想であったわけではない。
sen.e: Of course, there are absolutely no doubts that it was commonly thought that Genji clan members should be shoguns as it was they who had marshaled the collective power of Japan's samurai.
Of course, there are absolutely no doubts that it was commonly thought that Genji clan members should be shoguns as it was they who had marshaled the collective power of Japan's samurai.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Of course, there are absolutely no doubts that it was commonly thought that Minamoto clan members should be shoguns as it was they who had marshaled the collective power of Japan's samurai.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

tit.j: 実朝の将軍在職中に北条時政が実朝を排除して代わりに将軍職に就けようと押し立てた平賀朝雅は源氏である。
tit.e: At the time Sanetomo was serving as Shogun, Tomomasa HIRAGA (who was a Genji) was providing backing for the removal of Sanetomo and replacement with Tokimasa HOJO.
tit.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
tit.e: At the time Sanetomo was serving as Shogun, Tomomasa HIRAGA (who was a Genji) was providing backing for the removal of Sanetomo and replacement with Tokimasa HOJO.
At the time Sanetomo was serving as Shogun, Tomomasa HIRAGA (who was a Minamoto clan) was providing backing for the removal of Sanetomo and replacement with Tokimasa HOJO.
tit.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 藤原頼経が実朝暗殺後の将軍となった。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Yoritsune became the Shogun following the assassination of Sanetomo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Yoritsune became the Shogun following the assassination of Sanetomo.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Yoritsune became the Shogun following the assassination of Sanetomo.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 鎌倉に迎えられる際、源氏改姓が評議されたこともありました。
sen.e: Upon his return to Kamakura, there were also discussions about him changing his name to Genji.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Upon his return to Kamakura, there were also discussions about him changing his name to Genji.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Upon his return to Kamakura, there were also discussions about him changing his name to Minamoto clan.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 霜月騒動の折には、安達泰盛と対立した平頼綱が「泰盛の子安達宗景が藤原氏から源氏に改姓し将軍にならんとする陰謀あり」と執権北条貞時に讒言している。
sen.e: At the time of the Shimotsuki Incident, TAIRA no Yoritsuna`s opponent Yasumori ADACHI defamed Regent Sadatoki HOJO by claiming "there is a plot in essence that Yasumori`s child Muneage ADACHI is Fujiwara clan therefore unless he changes his name to Genji he can not become Shogun".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: At the time of the Shimotsuki Incident, TAIRA no Yoritsuna`s opponent Yasumori ADACHI defamed Regent Sadatoki HOJO by claiming "there is a plot in essence that Yasumori`s child Muneage ADACHI is Fujiwara clan therefore unless he changes his name to Genji he can not become Shogun".
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: At the time of the Shimotsuki Sodo (political change of Kamakura bakufu), TAIRA no Yoritsuna's opponent Yasumori ADACHI defamed Regent Sadatoki HOJO by claiming 'there is a plot in essence that Yasumori's child Munekage ADACHI is Fujiwara clan therefore unless he changes his name to Minamoto clan he can not become Shogun.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーション、スペルなどを変えました。

sen.j: また、7代将軍として推戴された惟康親王ははじめ親王宣下がなされず惟康王であったが、後に実際に臣籍降下して源姓を賜り源惟康となった。
sen.e: Also, presiding as the 7th Shogun, Prince Koreyasu was the first prince to be made Shogun without an imperial edict however, subsequently in actuality he became a member of the royal family that was subject to the state and took the Minamoto (Genji) name of Koreyasu MINAMOTO.

Also, presiding as the 7th Shogun, Prince Koreyasu was the first prince to be made Shogun without an imperial edict however, subsequently in actuality he became a member of the royal family that was subject to the state and took the Minamoto (Genji) name of Koreyasu MINAMOTO.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Also, presiding as the seventh Shogun, Imperial Prince Koreyasu was the first prince to be made Shogun without an imperial edict however, subsequently in actuality he became a member of the royal family that was subject to the state and took the Minamoto clan of Koreyasu MINAMOTO.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 後嵯峨天皇の皇子・6代将軍宗尊親王の王子である惟康が臣籍降下せねばならぬ理由は朝廷側にはなく幕府側の要請によるとの説もある。
sen.e: It has been said that Koreyasu (prince of the 6th Shogun Munetaka, who himself was Imperial Prince of Emperor Go-Saga) had to become royalty-subject-to-the-state at the behest of the Bakufu (Shogunate) and, not at the wish of the Imperial family side.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It has been said that Koreyasu (prince of the 6th Shogun Munetaka, who himself was Imperial Prince of Emperor Go-Saga) had to become royalty-subject-to-the-state at the behest of the Bakufu (Shogunate) and, not at the wish of the Imperial family side.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: It has been said that Koreyasu (prince of the sixth Shogun Imperial Prince Munetaka, who himself was Imperial Prince of Emperor Gosaga) had to be demoted from nobility to subject at the behest of the bakufu and, not at the wish of the Imperial family side.
sen.cmt: 統一リスト、用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: これは幕府の主宰者は源氏将軍たるべき理想観念が当時、御家人の中に根強かったのではないかといわれている。
sen.e: This was because the view that the leader of the Bakufu had to be a Minamoto (Genji) Shogun was deeply rooted amongst lower ranked vassals at that time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: This was because the view that the leader of the Bakufu had to be a Minamoto (Genji) Shogun was deeply rooted amongst lower ranked vassals at that time.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: This was because the view that the leader of the Bakufu had to be a Minamoto (Genji) Shogun was deeply rooted amongst lower ranked vassals at that time.
sen.cmt: 半角にし、前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: しかし、当時、幕府の実権は執権北条氏の手中にあった。
sen.e: However, at the time the real power of the Bakufu (Shogunate) was held in the hands of the Shogun's Regents: the Hojo clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, at the time the real power of the Bakufu (Shogunate) was held in the hands of the Shogun's Regents: the Hojo clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: However, at the time the real power of the bakufu was held in the hands of the Shogun's Regents, the Hojo clan.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 将軍の地位はまさに傀儡か象徴的意味しか持ち合わせず。
sen.e: The Shogun's position to be precise was no more than as a puppet or symbolic figurehead.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Shogun's position to be precise was no more than as a puppet or symbolic figurehead.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The Shogun's position to be precise was no more than as a puppet or symbolic figurehead.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 北条氏からしてみれば将軍が源氏として求心力を持つことは回避したい事態でありました。
sen.e: From the Hojo clan's viewpoint, they wished to offset a situation where cohesive unifying power were held by the Genji clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: From the Hojo clan's viewpoint, they wished to offset a situation where cohesive unifying power were held by the Genji clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: From the Hojo clan's viewpoint, they wished to offset a situation where cohesive unifying power were held by the Minamoto clan.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 事実、惟康親王は臣籍の身から親王宣下がなされた上で将軍の座を追われた。
sen.e: In fact, besides Prince Koreyasu changing status (a subject of the state) by imperial proclamation, he was also removed from being Shogun.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In fact, besides Prince Koreyasu changing status (a subject of the state) by imperial proclamation, he was also removed from being Shogun.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In fact, besides Imperial Prince Koreyasu received the title of Imperial Prince by Imperial Order from status of a subject, he was also removed from being shogun.
sen.cmt: スペースを除き、前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 従兄弟（後深草天皇の皇子）の久明親王が幼くして将軍として擁立された。
sen.e: Koreyasu's male cousin Prince Hisaakira (Imperial prince of Emperor Go-Fukakusa) was a very young child when he received the backing to be Shogun.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Koreyasu's male cousin Prince Hisaakira (Imperial prince of Emperor Go-Fukakusa) was a very young child when he received the backing to be Shogun.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Koreyasu's male cousin Imperial Prince Hisaaki (Imperial Prince of Emperor Gofukakusa) was a very young child when he assumed the position of shogun.
sen.cmt: 半角にし、クォーテーションを変え、統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: かつ臣籍降下も行われることなく、その王子守邦親王も宮将軍として将軍擁立がなされた。
sen.e: Furthermore, there was no changing royal status to that of a subject and, Prince Morikuni also received backing to become an Imperial Shogun.
Furthermore, there was no changing royal status to that of a subject and, Prince Morikuni also received backing to become an Imperial Shogun.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Furthermore, there was no demotion from nobility to subject and, Imperial Prince Morikuni, who also received backing to become a shogun as a miyashogun.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 源氏将軍復活と源氏将軍神話誕生の過程
sen.e: Process of Revival of the Genji Shoguns & Creation of Genji Shogun Legends
Process of Revival of the Genji Shoguns & Creation of Genji Shogun Legends
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Process of Revival of the Genji Shoguns and Creation of Genji Shogun Legends
sen.cmt: 表記を変えました。

sen.j: 元弘3年（1333年）、鎌倉幕府が滅亡し、後醍醐天皇の建武の新政をめぐる国内の動揺のさなかであった。
sen.e: In 1333 the Kamakura Bakufu (Shogunate) collapsed and Emperor Go-Daigo moved towards setting up a new Kenmu administration amongst a escalating disturbances across Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1333 the Kamakura Bakufu (Shogunate) collapsed and Emperor Go-Daigo moved towards setting up a new Kenmu administration amongst a escalating disturbances across Japan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In 1333 the Kamakura bakufu collapsed and Emperor Godaigo moved towards setting up a new Kenmu Administration amongst a escalating disturbances across Japan.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 清和源氏それもかつての源氏将軍たる頼朝と同じ。
sen.e: With this in mind as well, the Seiwa Minamoto clan also looked towards a Genji Shogun of the ilk of MINAMOTO no Yoritomo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: With this in mind as well, the Seiwa Minamoto clan also looked towards a Genji Shogun of the ilk of MINAMOTO no Yoritomo.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: With this in mind as well, the Seiwa-Genji also looked towards a Genji Shogun of the ilk of MINAMOTO no Yoritomo.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 河内源氏の出身である足利尊氏が北朝を擁立し、征夷大将軍に任ぜられ室町幕府を開いたことで、約120年ぶりの源氏将軍が復活することとなった。
sen.e: Takuji ASHIKAGA who also shared Kawachi Genji clan origins backed the Northern Dynasty and, served as unifying commander-in-chief Shogun at the opening of the Muromachi Bakufu (Shogunate) that went on to see a revival in the Genji Shoguns for around the next 120 years.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Takuji ASHIKAGA who also shared Kawachi Genji clan origins backed the Northern Dynasty and, served as unifying commander-in-chief Shogun at the opening of the Muromachi Bakufu (Shogunate) that went on to see a revival in the Genji Shoguns for around the next 120 years.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Takauji ASHIKAGA who also shared Kawachi-Genji origins backed the Northern Dynasty and, served as seii taishogun at the opening of the Muromachi bakufu that went on to see a revival in the Genji Shoguns for around the next 120 years.
sen.cmt: スペル修正し、前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 『太平記』によれば、後醍醐天皇の親政下の建武 (日本)2年（1335年）、鎌倉幕府とともに滅亡した北条高時の遺児 北条時行が叛旗を翻し鎌倉に攻め上った。
sen.e: According to the epic war tale `Taiheiki` (Chronicle of Great Peace), in 1335 when under the direct rule of Emperor Go-Daigo, spouting rebellion Tokiyuki HOJO (orphan of Takatoki HOJO who had been destroyed along with the Kamakura Bakufu (Shogunate)) marched on Kamakura.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: According to the epic war tale `Taiheiki` (Chronicle of Great Peace), in 1335 when under the direct rule of Emperor Go-Daigo, spouting rebellion Tokiyuki HOJO (orphan of Takatoki HOJO who had been destroyed along with the Kamakura Bakufu (Shogunate)) marched on Kamakura.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: According to the epic war tale "Taiheiki" (the Record of the Great Peace), in 1335 when under the direct rule of Emperor Godaigo, spouting rebellion Tokiyuki HOJO (orphan of Takatoki HOJO who had been destroyed along with the Kamakura bakufu) marched on Kamakura.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: その際、足利尊氏は、次のように述べた。
sen.e: Whereupon, Takauji ASHIKAGA stated more or less "Initially for generations the unifying commander-in-chief Shogun was a fellow Genpei (Genji or Heike clan) clansman but that status has no bearing.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Whereupon, Takauji ASHIKAGA stated more or less "Initially for generations the unifying commander-in-chief Shogun was a fellow Genpei (Genji or Heike clan) clansman but that status has no bearing.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Whereupon, Takauji ASHIKAGA stated more or less as follows.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。ルールに従い分割しなおしました。

sen.j: 「そもそも征夷将軍の任は代々の源平の輩、其の位に居するの例、計らず。」
sen.e: This matter at hand in places has deep significance on the profound wishes of Imperial Court and, the families." In other words, in relation to the countless examples of members of the Minamoto (Genji) and Taira (Heike) clans serving as commander-in-chief Shogun, and besides being the recipient of Shogun proclamations, he wished to report to the Emperor that the Hojo clan had been subjugated.

This matter at hand in places has deep significance on the profound wishes of Imperial Court and, the families." In other words, in relation to the countless examples of members of the Minamoto (Genji) and Taira (Heike) clans serving as commander-in-chief Shogun, and besides being the recipient of Shogun proclamations, he wished to report to the Emperor that the Hojo clan had been subjugated.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Initially for generations seii taishogun was a fellow Genpei (Minamoto clan and Taira clan) clansman but that status has no bearing.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。ルールに従い分割しなおし、表現を変えました。

sen.j: 「此の一事、殊に朝の為、家の為、望み深き所なり」
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: This matter at hand in places has deep significance on the profound wishes of Imperial Court and, the families.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。ルールに従い分割しなおしました。

sen.j: 即ち、源氏平氏が征夷大将軍の任についた例は数えきれないとして、自らも将軍宣下を受けた上で北条討伐を行いたいと奏上したという。
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In other words, in relation to the countless examples of members of the Minamoto and Taira clans serving as seii taishogun, and besides being the recipient of Shogun proclamations, he wished to report to the Emperor that the Hojo clan had been subjugated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。ルールに従い分割しなおしました。

sen.j: その願いを却下された足利尊氏は勝手に北条討伐の軍を起こした。
sen.e: Dismissing these wishes, Takauji ASHIKAGA took it upon himself to raise an army to suppress the Hojo clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Dismissing these wishes, Takauji ASHIKAGA took it upon himself to raise an army to suppress the Hojo clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Dismissing these wishes, Takauji ASHIKAGA took it upon himself to raise an army to suppress the Hojo clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 朝廷の断りなく諸国の武家を従える挙に及んだため、朝廷から討伐されることとなりました。
sen.e: Without notifying the Imperial Court, in order to make plans to subjugate Samurai in various provinces, it was made to look as if the subjugation drive emanated from the Imperial court.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Without notifying the Imperial Court, in order to make plans to subjugate Samurai in various provinces, it was made to look as if the subjugation drive emanated from the Imperial court.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Without notifying the Imperial Court, in order to make plans to subjugate samurai families in various provinces, it was made to look as if the subjugation drive emanated from the Imperial court.
sen.cmt: 一部補足しました。

sen.j: 新たに北朝を擁立して征夷大将軍に任ぜられることで室町幕府を開府、源氏将軍を復活させた。
sen.e: With fresh backing from the Northern Dynasty, and serving as Takauji ASHIKAGA commander-in-chief Shogun, the Genji line of warriors was revived.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: With fresh backing from the Northern Dynasty, and serving as Takauji ASHIKAGA commander-in-chief Shogun, the Genji line of warriors was revived.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: With fresh backing from the Northern Dynasty and serving as seii taishogun, he established Muromachi bakufu and revived the Genji Shogun.
sen.cmt: 一部補足しました。

sen.j: 足利将軍家がかつての源氏将軍と同族であった。
sen.e: The house of Ashikaga Shoguns was the same as what was previously the house of Genji Shoguns.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The house of Ashikaga Shoguns was the same as what was previously the house of Genji Shoguns.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The house of Ashikaga Shogun families was the same as what was previously the house of Genji Shoguns.
sen.cmt: 一部補足しました。

sen.j: 将軍職を独占し続け、その支配の正統性を主張する中であたかも「武家政権の長は源氏であるべき」、「源氏でなければ将軍になれない」という誤解ともいえる観念が生じたものと考えられている。
sen.e: Monopolization of the role of Shogun continued and, possible misunderstandings can be seen that place emphasis on the legitimacy of that control such as: "To be Shogun one had to be Genji".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Monopolization of the role of Shogun continued and, possible misunderstandings can be seen that place emphasis on the legitimacy of that control such as: "To be Shogun one had to be Genji".
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Monopolization of the role of Shogun continued and emphasis on the legitimacy of their control possible misunderstandings can be seen such as 'the chief of military government should be Minamoto clan ' or 'to be shogun one had to be Minamoto clan.'
sen.cmt: 一部補足しました。

sen.j: しかし、戦国時代 (日本)、室町幕府を実質的に滅ぼした。
sen.e: However, the Muromachi Bakufu (Shogunate) was substantially destroyed during the Warring States (Japan) period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, the Muromachi Bakufu (Shogunate) was substantially destroyed during the Warring States (Japan) period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: However, the Muromachi bakufu was substantially destroyed during the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。

sen.j: 平氏を称する織田信長が新たな天下人かと目された折 朝廷は信長に征夷大将軍、太政大臣、関白いずれの官職が希望かを問うた（三職推任問題）といわれる。
sen.e: Nobunaga ODA calling himself a Taira, distinguished himself as the new pre-eminent leader at a that time and assumed whatever official role he wished: commander-in-chief Shogun, Dadodaijin (Prime Minister) or Kanpaku (Regent to an adult emperor) which is said to have resulted in the '3 Role Support Problem' (三職推任問題).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Nobunaga ODA calling himself a Taira, distinguished himself as the new pre-eminent leader at a that time and assumed whatever official role he wished: commander-in-chief Shogun, Dadodaijin (Prime Minister) or Kanpaku (Regent to an adult emperor) which is said to have resulted in the '3 Role Support Problem' (三職推任問題).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Nobunaga ODA calling himself a Taira, distinguished himself as the new pre-eminent leader at a that time, is said to have been assumed by the Imperial Court whatever official role he wished: Seii taishogun, Daijo-daijin (Grand minister of state) or Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) ('sanshoku suinin mondai' (the question of the three alternative positions)).
sen.cmt: 表現を変え、用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: このように、源氏将軍がその地位をほしいままにしている場合でない限り、源氏でなければ将軍にしないという理由はやはりなかった。
sen.e: It therefore can not be justified to say only Genji were allowed to be Shogun as there were limitations to a Genji Shogun obtaining any role they happened to desire.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It therefore can not be justified to say only Genji were allowed to be Shogun as there were limitations to a Genji Shogun obtaining any role they happened to desire.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: It therefore can not be justified to say only Minamoto clan were allowed to be Shogun as there were limitations to a Genji Shogun obtaining any role they happened to desire.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: しかし、信長の後継者として天下統一を果たした豊臣秀吉も将軍職を欲した。
sen.e: However, Nobunaga`s successor, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI managed to unify the whole country and also sought the role of Shogun.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, Nobunaga`s successor, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI managed to unify the whole country and also sought the role of Shogun.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: However, Nobunaga's successor, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI managed to unify the whole country and also sought the role of Shogun.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。

sen.j: 室町幕府15代将軍の足利義昭に猶子とするよう要請し断られたといわれる説もある。
sen.e: It is said that Hideyoshi took it upon himself to dismiss requests from Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA (15th generation of Shogun in the Muromachi Bakufu (Shogunate) as if he were a young nephew.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It is said that Hideyoshi took it upon himself to dismiss requests from Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA (15th generation of Shogun in the Muromachi Bakufu (Shogunate) as if he were a young nephew.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: It is said that Hideyoshi took it upon himself to dismiss requests from Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, 15th generation of Shogun in the Muromachi bakufu, to adopt Hideyoshi as his child.
sen.cmt: 表現を変えました。

sen.j: さらにその後、藤原姓を称したこともある徳川家康が源氏として征夷大将軍に任ぜられ、日本史上3人しかいない幕府開府者がいずれも源氏となったこともあって、源氏でなければ将軍になれないという源氏将軍神話、源氏将軍信仰が生まれたと考えられている。
sen.e: In addition, subsequently Ieyasu TOKUGAWA who had assumed the Fujiwara title was as a Genji appointed as commander-in-chief Shogun and, notwithstanding in each case the 3 founders of Bakufu (Shogunate) regimes in Japan's history had come from Genji stock, the `Genji legend` that only a Genji could be shogun and, Genji myth came into existence.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In addition, subsequently Ieyasu TOKUGAWA who had assumed the Fujiwara title was as a Genji appointed as commander-in-chief Shogun and, notwithstanding in each case the 3 founders of Bakufu (Shogunate) regimes in Japan's history had come from Genji stock, the `Genji legend` that only a Genji could be shogun and, Genji myth came into existence.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In addition, subsequently Ieyasu TOKUGAWA who had assumed the Fujiwara clan was as a Minamoto clan appointed as seii taishogun and, notwithstanding in each case the three founders of the bakufu regimes in Japan's history had come from Minamoto clan stock, the Minamoto clan legend that only a Minamoto clan could be shogun and, Minamoto clan belief came into existence.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。
